column1: Uchi////Makimono: On the happy hour menu
column2: they are $6 each compared to twice as much on the regular menu. I especially enjoyed the crunchy spicy tuna and shag roll. I'm usually not a roll person but I thought these were very well executed. They are not gigantic
column3: rather they are cut into dainty pieces. The fish that they use is not the mashed up dregs that other restaurants employ. I had whole chunks of fresh fish. I even liked the light tempura frying of the shag roll (not greasy at all!). I did not enjoy the ham and eggs roll as much. The pork and thick sauces were just too heavy to work as sushi.
